doc:
Edyth Walker https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edyth_Walker 0 Edyth Walker (March 27, 1867 – February 19, 1950) was an American opera singer who had an active international career from the 1890s through the 1910s. She began her career performing roles from the mezzo-soprano repertory, but later successfully added several soprano parts to her repertoire as well. While she did perform in Italian and French language operas, she had a clear affinity for works in the German language. She particularly excelled in the operas of Richard Wagner. After retiring from the stage, she was active as a voice teacher in both France and the United States. Her voice is preserved on several gramophone recordings, made mainly for His Master's Voice, between 1902-08. Edyth_Walker ( March_27_,_1867 – February_19_,_1950 ) was an_American_opera_singer who had an_active_international_career from the_1890s through the_1910s . She began her_career performing roles from the_mezzo-soprano_repertory , but later successfully added several_soprano_parts to her_repertoire as_well . While she did_perform in Italian_and_French_language_operas , she had a_clear_affinity for works in the_German_language . She particularly excelled in the_operas of Richard_Wagner . After retiring from the_stage , she was active as a_voice_teacher in both_France and the_United_States . Her_voice is_preserved on several_gramophone_recordings , made mainly for His_Master 's_Voice , between 1902-08 .
